sect2.para: The Udev package contains programs for dynamic creation of device nodes.

sect2.title: Installation of Udev
sect2.para: The udev-config tarball contains LFS-specific files used to configure Udev. Unpack it into the Udev source directory:
Create some devices and directories that Udev cannot handle due to them being required very early in the boot process:

screen.userinput: install -dv /lib/{firmware,udev/devices/{pts,shm}} mknod -m0666 /lib/udev/devices/null c 1 3 ln -sv /proc/self/fd /lib/udev/devices/fd ln -sv /proc/self/fd/0 /lib/udev/devices/stdin ln -sv /proc/self/fd/1 /lib/udev/devices/stdout ln -sv /proc/self/fd/2 /lib/udev/devices/stderr ln -sv /proc/kcore /lib/udev/devices/core
make EXTRAS="extras/ata_id extras/cdrom_id extras/edd_id \ extras/firmware extras/floppy extras/path_id extras/rule_generator \ extras/scsi_id extras/usb_id extras/volume_id"

variablelist.title: The meaning of the make option:

listitem.para: This builds several helper binaries that can aid in writing custom Udev rules.

sect2.para: To test the results, issue: make test.
Note that the Udev testsuite will produce numerous messages in the host system's logs. These are harmless and can be ignored.

screen.userinput: make DESTDIR=/ \ EXTRAS="extras/ata_id extras/cdrom_id extras/edd_id \ extras/firmware extras/floppy extras/path_id extras/rule_generator \ extras/scsi_id extras/usb_id extras/volume_id" install

variablelist.title: The meaning of the make parameter:

listitem.para: This prevents the Udev build process from killing any udevd processes that may be running on the host system.
